RecipeInstructions: Add milk, pumpkin puree, and sugar to a saucepan over medium heat. Heat until hot, but do not boil.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the vanilla, pumpkin pie spice, and the coffee.
Divide the mixture between two mugs. Top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice.

RecipeIngredients: pomegranate seeds and fresh rosemary for garnishes
RecipeInstructions: Combine rye, lemon juice, pomegranate juice, honey simple syrup, liqueur, and bitters in a punch bowl and chill until cold, about 3 hours.
Thirty minutes before serving, add ice cubes or ice ring (the punch tastes better slightly diluted).
Just before serving, add club soda and garnish with cloves. Serve over ice.
Recipes.RecipeNutrition: Serving Size 1 drink / Calories 171 / Protein 9 g / Carbohydrate 21 g / Dietary Fiber 1 g / Total Sugars 20 g / Total Fat 6 g / Saturated Fat 4 g / Cholesterol 24 mg

RecipeIngredients: 1 cup (8 oz.) strongly-brewed earl grey tea
RecipeInstructions: Brew earl grey tea and lavender together, and steep for 3 minutes. Remove tea bag and strain out the lavender.
Meanwhile, add the milk to a small saucepan set over medium heat. Heat until just steaming.
Add the milk to the mug and stir in the vanilla and honey. Finally, top with a sprinkle of cinnamon and whipped cream.
Recipes.RecipeNutrition: Serving Size 1 drink / Calories 121 / Protein 7 g / Carbohydrate 18 g / Dietary Fiber 1 g / Total Sugars 13 g / Total Fat 2 g / Saturated Fat 4 g / Cholesterol 21 mg

RecipeInstructions: Stir boiling water, tea bags, ginger, lemon, honey and rosemary together in large heatproof bowl.
Steep, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes. The longer it steeps, the better, as the tea will be stronger.
Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on the tea bags to get as much liquid out as possible. Top with fresh sliced ginger and serve.
Recipes.RecipeNutrition: Serving Size 1 drink / Calories 6 / Protein 0.1 g / Carbohydrate 1.2 g / Dietary Fiber 1 g / Total Sugars 3 g / Total Fat 0 g / Saturated Fat 0 g / Cholesterol 1 mg

RecipeInstructions: In large pot over medium heat, add apples, oranges, spices, and brown sugar. Cover with water by at least 2‚Äù. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours.
Remove orange halves, then use wooden spoon to mash apples. Return to a simmer and let simmer for 1 hour.
Strain then pressing on solids with a wooden spoon to squeeze all juices out. Discard solids and serve.
